data.name: uCecTxFrameHeader
description: Header block in the transmitted frame

data.name: uCecTxFrameData0
description: Opcode block in the transmitted frame

description: Operand 1 in the transmitted frame

description: Operand 2 in the transmitted frame

data.name: uReserved7_5
description: No description

data.name: uCecTxFrameLength
description: Message size of the transmitted frame. This is the number of byte in the outgoing message including the
header.

data.name: uReserved7_1
description: No description

data.name: uCecTxEnable
description: This bit enables the TX section. When set to 1 it initiates the start of transmission of the message in
the outgoing message buffer. When the message transmission is completed this bit is automatically reset to
what stage of the transmission process has been reached. If the message transmission is sill in the
the transmission will continue until the message is fully sent, or until an error condition occurs.
0. If it is manually set to 0 during a message transmission it may terminate the transmission depending on

values.description: Transmission mode disabled
Transmission mode enabled and message transmission started

data.name: uReserved7
description: No description

data.name: uCecTxRetry
description: The number of times the CEC TX should try to retransmit the message if an error condition is encountered.
Per the CEC spec this value should not be set to a value greater than 5.

values.description: Try to retransmit the message 1 time if an error occurs

data.name: uCecRetrySft
description: Signal Free Time of periods for retransmission retry. This parameter should be set to a value equal to or
greater than 3 and strictly less than 5.

data.name: uCecTxSft2
description: R/W Signal Free Time if the device is a new initiator. This parameter should be set to a value equal to or
greater than 5 and strictly less than 7.

data.name: uCecTxSft1
description: R/W Signal Free Time if the device transmits a next frame immediately after its previous frame. This
parameter should be set to a value equal to or greater than 7 and strictly less than 10.

data.name: uCecTxLowdriveCounter
description: The number of times that the LOWDRIVE error condition was encountered while trying to send the current
message. This register is reset to 0b0000 when CEC_TX_ENABLE is set to 1.

values.description: No error condition

data.name: uCecTxNackCounter
description: The number of times that the NACK error condition was encountered while trying to send the current
message. This register is reset to 0b0000 when CEC_TX_ENABLE is set to 1.

values.description: No error condition

data.name: uCecBuf0RxFrameHeader
description: Header block of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0.

description: Operand 7 of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0

description: Operand 9 of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0

description: Operand 11 of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0

description: Operand 12 of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0

description: Operand 13 of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0

description: Operand 14 of the received frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0

data.name: uReserved7_5
description: No description

data.name: uCecBuf0RxFrameLength
description: R xxxxx - The total number of bytes (including header byte) that were received into buffer 0

data.name: uReserved7
description: No description

data.name: uCecLogicalAddressMask
description: Logical Address mask of the CEC logical devices. Up to 3 logical devices are supported. When the mask bits
are set for a particular logical device, the logical device is enabled and messages whose destination
address matches that of the selected logical address will be accepted.

data.name: uCecErrorReportMode
description: Error report mode

values.description: Only report short bit period errors
Report both short and long bit period errors

data.name: uCecErrorDetMode
description: Error detection mode
drives the CEC line low for 3.6ms
target CEC device, the CEC controller immediately drives the CEC line low for 3.6ms

values.description: If any short bit period error, except for start bit, is detected, the CEC controller immediately
If a short bit period is detected in the data block where the destination is the CEC section or a

data.name: uCecForceNack
description: Force NO-ACK Control
Setting this bit forces the CEC controller not acknowledge any received messages.

values.description: Acknowledge received messages
Do not acknowledge received messages

data.name: uCecForceIgnore
description: Force Ignore Control. Setting this bit forces the CEC controller to ignore any directly addressed
messages. Normal operation should be kept for the broadcast message

values.description: Do not ignore directly address messages
Ignore any directly addressed message

data.name: uCecLogicalAddress1
description: Logical address 1 - this address must be enabled by setting CEC_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_MASK[1] to 1

values.description: Default value

data.name: uCecLogicalAddress0
description: Logical address 0 - this address must be enabled by setting CEC_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_MASK[0] to 1

values.description: Default value

data.name: uReserved7_4
description: No description

data.name: uCecLogicalAddress2
description: Logical address 2 - this address must be enabled by setting CEC_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_MASK[2] to 1

values.description: Default value

data.name: uReserved7_1
description: No description

data.name: uCecPowerUp
description: Power Mode of CEC module

values.description: Power down the CEC module
Power up the CEC module

data.name: uReserved7_6
description: No description

data.name: uCecGlitchFilterCtrl
description: The CEC input signal is sampled by the input clock (XTAL clock). CEC_GLITCH_FILTER_CTRL specifies the
minimum pulse width requirement in input clock cycles. Pulses of widths less than the minimum specified
width are considered glitches and will be removed by the filter.

values.description: Disable the glitch filter
Filter out pulses with width less than 1 clock cycle
Filter out pulses with width less than 2 clock cycles
Filter out pulses with width less than 7 clock cycles
Filter out pulses with width less than 63 clock cycles

data.name: uReserved7_4
description: No description

data.name: uCecClrRxRdy2
description: Clear control for CEC_RX_RDY2

values.description: Retain the value of the CEC_RX_RDY2 flag
Clear the value of the CEC_RX_RDY2 flag

data.name: uCecClrRxRdy1
description: Clear control for CEC_RX_RDY1

values.description: Retain the value of the CEC_ RX_RDY1 flag
Clear the value of the CEC_RX_RDY1 flag

data.name: uCecClrRxRdy0
description: Clear control for CEC_RX_RDY0

values.description: Retain the value of the CEC_RX_RDY0 flag
Clear the value of the CEC_RX_RDY0 flag

data.name: uCecSoftReset
description: CEC module software reset.

values.description: No function
Reset the CEC module

data.name: uReserved7_3
description: No description

data.name: uCecDisAutoMode
description: A control to disable the automatic CEC power up feature when in chip powerdown mode.

values.description: Automatic power up feature enabled
Automatic power up feature disabled

data.name: uReserved1_0
description: No description

data.name: uReserved7_6
description: No description

data.name: uCecBuf2Timestamp
description: Time stamp for frame stored in receiver frame buffer 2. This can be used to determine which frame should
be read next from the receiver frame buffers.

values.description: Invalid timestamp, no frame is available in this frame buffer
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the first to be received
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the second to be received
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the third to be received

data.name: uCecBuf1Timestamp
description: Time stamp for frame stored in receiver frame buffer 1. This can be used to determine which frame should
be read next from the receiver frame buffers.

values.description: Invalid timestamp, no frame is available in this frame buffer
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the first to be received
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the second to be received
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the third to be received

data.name: uCecBuf0Timestamp
description: Time stamp for frame stored in receiver frame buffer 0. This can be used to determine which frame should
be read next from the receiver frame buffers.

values.description: Invalid timestamp, no frame is available in this frame buffer
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the first to be received
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the second to be received
Of the frames currently buffered, this frame was the third to be received

data.name: uReserved7_3
description: No description

data.name: uCecRxRdy2
description: CEC_RX_RDY2 flags that a CEC frame has been received and is waiting to be read in receiver frame buffer 2.
This flag must be cleared via CEC_CLR_RX_RDY2 before another message can be received in receiver frame
buffer 2.

values.description: No CEC frame available in buffer 2
A CEC frame is available in buffer 2

data.name: uCecRxRdy1
description: CEC_RX_RDY1 flags that a CEC frame has been received and is waiting to be read in receiver frame buffer 2.
This flag must be cleared via CEC_CLR_RX_RDY1 before another message can be received in receiver frame
buffer 1.

values.description: No CEC frame available in buffer 1
A CEC frame is available in buffer 1

data.name: uCecRxRdy0
description: CEC_RX_RDY0 flags that a CEC frame has been received and is waiting to be read in receiver frame buffer 2.
This flag must be cleared via CEC_CLR_RX_RDY0 before another message can be received in receiver frame
buffer 0.

values.description: No CEC frame available in buffer 0
A CEC frame is available in buffer 0

data.name: uReserved7_1
description: No description

data.name: uCecUseAllBufs
description: Control to enable supplementary receiver frame buffers.

values.description: Use only buffer 0 to store CEC frames
Use all 3 buffers to stores the CEC frames

data.name: uCecWakeOpcode0
description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE0
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates
an interrupt that can be used to alert the system that a CEC opcode of interest has been received and
requires a response.

values.description: POWER ON

data.name: uCecWakeOpcode1
description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE1
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates
an interrupt that can be used to alert the system that a CEC opcode of interest has been received and
requires a response.

values.description: GIVE POWER STATUS

data.name: uCecWakeOpcode2
description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE2
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates
an interrupt that can be used to alert the system that a CEC opcode of interest has been received and
requires a response.

values.description: ACTIVE SOURCE

data.name: uCecWakeOpcode3
description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE3
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates
an interrupt that can be used to alert the system that a CEC opcode of interest has been received and
requires a response.

values.description: IMAGE VIEW ON

data.name: uCecWakeOpcode4
description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE4
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates

values.description: TEXT VIEW ON

data.name: uCecWakeOpcode5
description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE5
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates

values.description: SYSTEM AUDIO MODE REQUEST

description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE6
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates

values.description: DECK CONTROL

description: CEC_WAKE_OPCODE7
This value can be set to a CEC opcode that requires a response. On receipt of this opcode the Rx generates

values.description: PLAY
